revised_title: Evolution of the Early Proterozoic Continental Margin: The Coronation Geosyncline and Associated Aulacogens of the Northwestern Canadian Shield
tldr: The article discusses the evolution of the early Proterozoic Coronation geosyncline and its associated aulacogens in the northwestern Canadian Shield. The geosyncline developed along the western margin of the Archaean Sve Province and culminated with the emplacement of a pair of batholiths. The evolution of the geosyncline is compared to Phanerozoic geosynclines, suggesting that early Proterozoic tectonics are similar to those of the Phanerozoic era.
